subs.text:
@ajSlainte @Mountainbaby @VanessaGreer20 @Lespal123 @canamKim @AshleyGWinter @David_Crayford @ufm_cultra The R stands for something like Rex/Regina, meaning King/Queen, and the first letter is the first letter of their first name.

So, you end up with abbreviations like:

GR = King George
CR = King Charles
VR = Queen Victoria
ER = Queen Elizabeth
E II R = Queen Elizabeth II
subs.rawText:
@ajSlainte @Mountainbaby @VanessaGreer20 @Lespal123 @canamKim @AshleyGWinter @David_Crayford @ufm_cultra The R stands for something like Rex/Regina, meaning King/Queen, and the first letter is the first letter of their first name.

So, you end up with abbreviations like:

GR = King George
CR = King Charles
VR = Queen Victoria
ER = Queen Elizabeth
E II R = Queen Elizabeth II

subs.text: @Cptn_Alex @bgolus @paulbettner What if new aircraft were designed with larger cockpits, so a newer (perhaps not even non-ATP-rated pilot for ‘ride-alongs’/familiarizations) pilot could regularly apprentice on regular revenue flights alongside the two required pilots?

subs.text:
@knightlight001 @TrentTelenko @PhillipsPOBrien Range is needed to deal with the full universe of potential threats. S-400 can still attack low-altitude targets closer to system, especially when placed close to high-value targets; UKR is just operating out of range.

Air superiority is ~supposed~ to deal with distant threats.
